data.title: Fish portion too small
data.text: Visited at 4pm on a weekday. Appetizers was raw oysters that were too small, the main entre was fish Mahi Mahi was also too small when compared to other fine restaurants, the salad was adequate and no desert. The music was low and appropriate, the service was timely but the waitress was seen near the table sweeping the floor, this was not appropriate for a fine restaurant. The interior decorations was elegant but lacking any theme.

data.title: Red Lobster, better than ever
data.text: I don't go to these types of restaurants often because I cook at home but this was a b-day party for my friend Donna. The server Jay was fan fabulous! Right on the money knowing menu questions, so pleasant. And with 12 people really worked his tail off! We were there for 1 1/2 hours and never felt pressure to hurry up,,the food was really good too. The lobster pizza and stuffed mushrooms were nicely done and my fish & chips was crispy and lite..lunch size even took home some. I rate this one A for everything!! Donna enjoyed her surf & turf...and key lime pie!

data.title: Quick lunch
data.text: Our server heather was amazing. Very fast and friendly. Coconut shrimp absolutely delicious. Cajun chicken Alfredo full of flavor, very big portion tho. Definitely worth the money spent

data.title: Wonderful tasting and delicious clam chowder
data.text:
Wonderful location, very fresh seafood, good cesar salad a the entry of the Ultimate Feast.

Good lobster, really fresh king crab and very good two recipies shrimps.

Good sides, rice and smash potatoes.

And we try a clam chowder, wonderful and really tasty !

data.title: Clean Family Style Chain Restaurant with EXCELLENT STAFF
data.text:
Very good location with free parking. The food is fresh and large amounts for the money.
I love all seafood dishes at Red Lobster.
The cheese biscuits are nice. 
SALTED BAKED POTATOES ARE REALLY GOOD!

data.title: Good Seafood
data.text: My husband always orders the fried fish.  He has never been disappointed.  I enjoy the shrimp and lobster.  I too have always raved about my dinner.  The service is fast and friendly.  The interior is the standard Red Lobster.

data.title: Not so impressed
data.text: The service was great, the atmosphere was great, the food has been in my opinion getting more and more processed.  My meal was ok but I would not recommend.  Years ago it was "the" place to go for seafood.  I dont know what happened.  Prices were a little high.

data.title: But the food is good
data.text: Everything was good. Linguine with lobster was good. Lobster bisque was v. good. Coconut shrimp was very good esp. the pineapple dip. Baked potato was good.  Brownie to go was super. Service was ok.  Easy parking. Wine at $6.50 and $7.50 was ok.  We will return next lobster season.

data.title: Great meal, good service
data.text: On a whim, we went to Red Lobster, it had been 3 or 4 years since we visited a Red Lobster, our experience tonight was great, our food came in hot and tasty, I ordered the Linguini with Lobster, yummy, my wife ordered the 2 lobster tails dinner, the potatoes on her dish were not cooked through, but the Corn and the Lobsters were awesome,I did not give 5 stars due to dirty napkins on the floor in the booth across from ours and the potatoes which were not done

data.title: A good family night
data.text: While a substantial wait time was to be expected on a Saturday night, especially for a group of 6, we were pleased to be quickly accomodated (within 25min, compared to 50+ at another major chain nearby) with a very friendly staff (even with kids crossing path of waiters all the time!)

data.title: Enjoyable dinner
data.text: The cocktails were delicious and reasonably priced, the seafood was good. Love the cheesy biscuits. Would eat here again.

data.title: Nice
data.text: Sweet chill shrimp love love lover  very nice waiter . Wait wasn't too live music could be better . Good good for a quick stop before you main event of the day

data.title: Good meals and  decent prices
data.text: We went for a dinner shortly after 6pm no line, straight in, and seated by the hostess.  The waitress was polite and quickly took drink orders, by the time she arrived back we were ready to place our meal orders, she dropped their delicious cheddar and garlic biscuits to the table, and returned in minutes with salads and appetizers.  Our main meals were fresh, not over cooked as tends to be the norm with lots of average seafood places.  My shrimp, lobster and vegetables were spot on, as were my companions fish and shrimp.  More biscuits, topped off drinks,service was great, as were the meals.

data.title: A "Main" surprise.
data.text:
In our tour of Florida in January 2016, we have had a few disappointments in trying to get into a restaurant mid evening, and have learnt our lesson. Now we try and get into a place before 6 PM. This paid off very well when we visited the Red Lobster a standard franchise of seafood all over the USA. In this particular restaurant, we got in early and looked after by a young lady who made it her aim to make our dinner and an enjoyable evening. I had not had a "Main" lobster for years and decided to go for that. I was not disappointed it was steamed to perfection and an ample supply of melted butter to help it down. (Sod the Cholesterol).
The only problem if you want to call it that, was the cleanliness of the cutlery, when set at our table it had a dull sheen to it, but a rub with our serviette brought it back to a bright shine, as it should have been, maybe the cutlery washing machine needs some maintenance?
Overall very pleased with our seafood dinner out. Would I return, very much so.

data.title: Lacking on behalf of server efforts
data.text:
Waiter never placed nor brought us any silverware to eat with, even nothing with our 1st course was brought to our table. Stopped another waiter and they brought us something to eat with. Place was pretty busy but still no excuse not to place silverware when menu's were brought. 
 My coconut shrimp were a little overcooked. Wife asked for a slight reduction in spices for her Cajun chicken. She said it had no flavor and was bland. It was a disappointing 1st nice dinner night in town. $51 and change with her frozen drink and my domestic beer, so the prices were fair. I think it was a $17.99 four course dinner with several choices of soup, sides and main course's. 
 Not sure if we will go back, to many other choices of places to eat in that area for the same money.

data.title: Poor
data.text: First time in Red Lobster and probably the last, service was mediocre with all the food arriving at the same time (starters and mains) waiter was a bit sullen and not really interested but above all the food was poor, just deep fried junk that was not very nice. It looks nothing like the TV adverts and I felt disappointed with the whole experience. Will not be going back.

data.title: First Time at Red Lobster
data.text: My daughter who lives here is always talking about Red Lobster, this was my first visit,and I was very mpressed,Service was a bit slow but they were busy,but would certainly revisit.

data.title: What an Anticlimax.......
data.text:
We had a hankering for King Crab legs, and after seeing the TV commercials decided to go for lunch. We had not been to Red Lobster for 10 years and decided to give it a try....what a MISTAKE!
We  ordered 2 of the split King Crab apps. Unfortunately they must have been split, then frozen! They were dry and tasteless, and at $2.50 a mouthful, we expected a lot more!
We decided to stop our losses at $50 and go elsewhere for the rest of our lunch. Never Again!

data.title: The "let down"
data.text: The atmosphere was good.. the service o.k. But...the food was of inferior quality and cooked in overused oil.The ads on t.v.are a dream ,your product a near nightmare .The dinner plate was a sea of brown over cooked seafood.

data.title: Best seafood and steak around.....
data.text: We ordered surf and turf and it was great. The service was great also and the steak was cooked to perfection! We will definitely be back!
